title: What was the debut song of BTS? - Quora

response.answer_text: THE DEBUT SONG OF BTS WAS NO MORE DREAM No More Dream Information Original title: No More Dream Released: June 12, 2013 Format: CD, digital download, streaming Length: 3:42 Language: Korean Label: Big Hit Entertainment Songwriter(s): Pdogg, "Hitman" Bang, RM, Suga, J-Hope, Supreme Boi Producer(s): Pdogg Chronology: Previous track	Next track Skit: Circle Room Talk	Interlude view • edit "No More Dream" is a song by South Korean boy group BTS. The song was released on June 12, 2013. This is their debut song and the fourth track in the debut album 2 Cool 4 Skool. This song has a Japanese version featured in the single NO MORE DREAM -Japanese Ver.- and in the album Wake Up. (Rap Monster/Jimin) To all the youngsters without dreams HOPE THIS ANSWER WAS HELPFUL

I mean they had a ton of predebut songs, but their first official song and debut is…. No More Dream!! On June 13, 2013.  I had a conversation with a girl another day during my gym period in school and she said she liked BTS and was a huge fan, along with listening to their songs a ton, so I tested her by asking what their debut song was. She responded, “Umm, is it Blood, Sweat, and Tears?” *mental facepalm* “No…” I answered. “BST was released in 2016. A while after they debuted, and their boost to popularity.” “Oh! Oh! I know!!” She jumps up excitedly. “Yes?” I responded eagerly. “Boy In Luv?!” Another mental facepalm. I then proceeded to explain to her it was No More Dream, and Boy In Luv was released in 2014, while NMD was released in 2013. I assumed she knew Boy In Luv because of Boy With Luv. Goes to show how their debut song needs more appreciation. Don’t forget, if it weren’t for this song, you wouldn’t get the new songs like Boy with Luv or DNA or Idol or Fake Love.
